lesson-7-writing.title: The True Story of Santa Claus

children.text: Đọc kỹ bài văn mẫu và hướng dẫn trong phần Writing Guide.
Viết một bài văn ngắn (150-200 từ) kể về một kỷ niệm Giáng sinh đáng nhớ nhất của em.
Nộp bài viết cho giáo viên chấm.
Chúc các em có một bài viết thật hay!

content.text: A narrative essay tells a story. For this assignment, you will tell the story of a special Christmas memory.

items: 1. Introduction: Set the scene. When was it? Where were you? Who was there? Start with a 'hook' to grab the reader's attention.
2. Body Paragraphs: Tell the story in chronological order (what happened first, next, then). Use sensory details (what did you see, hear, smell, feel?).
3. Conclusion: End the story. How did you feel? Why is this memory special to you?

content.text: Christmas is always a special time for my family, but the Christmas of 2019 was truly unforgettable. It wasn't because of the presents or the delicious food, but because of a surprise that brought tears of joy to everyone's eyes.

It was Christmas Eve, and my entire family was gathered in the living room. The tree was glowing with colorful lights, and the smell of roasted turkey filled the air. We were all excited to open our gifts. Suddenly, the doorbell rang. We looked at each other, puzzled, because we weren't expecting any guests. My father went to answer the door. A moment later, we heard him shout with joy.

Walking into the room was my older brother, who had been studying abroad in Australia for three years. He hadn't told anyone he was coming home! My mother burst into tears and ran to hug him. We all gathered around, laughing and crying at the same time. It was the best gift we could have asked for.
That Christmas taught me that the best gifts aren't things you can buy in a store. The presence of loved ones is the most precious present of all. It is a memory I will cherish forever.
